response.answer_text: The literal meaning of the term “Neolithic” is “new stone age”. It refers to cultures that use stone tools and weapons (i.e. haven’t discovered the use of metals) but have discovered agriculture (the planting of crops). “Palaeolithic” means “old stone age”. It refers to cultures that use stone implements and haven’t discovered agriculture. They are hunter-gatherers.

It’s synonymous with the advent of agriculture while having stone tools. Neolithic - Wikipedia  Reconstruction of a Neolithic settlement in modern-day Turkey Basically, it’s the period when people started to farm, but that’s not to say that all neolithic cultures were farmers. By the end of the period, people had started making pottery, and the firing of these objects in kilns is probably what made people discover copper as a by-product, eventually leading to the Chalcolithic, or Copper Age.
